clinical_study.brief_title: Sequential Compression Device (SCD) for Stabilizing Hemodynamics in the Beach Chair Position
clinical_study.official_title: Stabilizing Cerebral and Circulatory Hemodynamics During Shoulder Surgery in the Beach Chair Position Using Sequential Compression Device (SCD) or TED Stockings Compared to a Control Group

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a 3-legged randomized study examining whether during shoulder surgery performed in the beach chair position active compressions of the lower leg with a sequential compression device (SCD) have a superior effect on stabilizing cerebral and circulatory hemodynamics when compared to TED stockings or a control group without any stockings.

detailed_description.textblock: This study examines whether during shoulder surgery performed in the beach chair position active compressions of the lower leg with a sequential compression device (SCD) have a superior effect on stabilizing cerebral and circulatory hemodynamics when compared to TED stockings or a control group without any stockings.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Caregiver), Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.description: cerebral oxygenation averaged of 1 min during the operation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: throughout duration of anaesthesia, approximately 60 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: amount of ephedrine used during surgery
cardiac output averaged over 1 minute during the entire surgery
stroke volume averaged over 1 minute during the entire surgery
MAP averaged over 1 minute during the entire surgery

arm_group.description: During arthroscopic shoulder surgery, an SCD device will be applied to the patients legs during surgery. Cerebral oxygenation and circulatory parameters will be recorded continuously throughout the surgery. Recordings will be hidden to the primary caregiver.

During arthroscopic shoulder surgery, TED stockings will be applied to the patients legs during surgery. Cerebral oxygenation and circulatory parameters will be recorded continuously throughout the surgery. Recordings will be hidden to the primary caregiver.
no stockings will be applied to the patients legs

intervention.description: a sequential compression device will be applied to the legs
TED stockings will be applied to the patients legs during surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- adult patients undergoing elective shoulder surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- untreated hypertension
- no pulse in a. dorsalis pedis or a.tibialis posterior
- leg ulcers
- failed scalenous blockade
